Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: JaKenn
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were spotless and the beds were comfy. Very close to several museums and Vondelpark. It is a little outside the centre but the tram is only a minutes walk which will take you there in less then 10 minutes. Being outside the centre, the neighbourhood is very quiet, so recommended if your a light sleeper. I thought it was a little overpriced at â‚¬80 per night for a twin room with shared shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: subead
Reviews.Content: Hotel Verdi is a quick 2 block walk to museumplein, a block from the Opera House and in a beautiful quiet neighborhood with a polite and helpful staff. The short tram trip from the Centraal Station dropped me off 1 block from Verdi. The breakfasts were delicious and plentiful with a huge variety of meats, cheeses, fruits, breads, teas, and the coffee was excellent. Our room on the top floor had a lovely view of the neighborhood. It was simply decorated (but outdated) with a comfortable bed and newly remodeled bathroom. The stairs were typical steep Dutch stairs, I recommend using the rail. I would stay at Hotel Verdi the next time I visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheStrand
Reviews.Content: This was a friendly, clean hotel with good facilities and the customary steep Amsterdam stairs! It is well located within easy walking distance from Vondelpark, the museums and the concert hall. I was especially impressed with the shower which had good water pressure and temperature control in a generously-sized cubicle. The beds were wonderfully soft and comfortable too. Enjoyed the buffet breakfast included in the rate which was very relaxing with classical music piped into the breakfast room. However, I thought the best thing was their beautiful ginger cat often found curled up on the chair just outside our 1st floor room! Top tip: there's a kettle in the room but no tea/ coffee or spoons, cups etc. so bring some along if you fancy a cuppa after a day's sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “lovely, clean and comfy place”
Reviews.Author: genkipanda
Reviews.Content: Hotel Verdi is a quick tram trip from Central Station and easily connects to trams to take you all over Amsterdam. It's a real quiet little spot a few blocks off of a very main street. Once you deliver your luggage it's very easy to take a tram to where you want to go or walk--nothing in Amsterdam is that far away. I had a basic single room, shower but shared toilet upstairs and even though I was right above reception and on the street it seemed very quiet to me. I even slept with my window open to get that cool summer air in and was fine. Breakfast was a nice inclusion (when I was researching places it seemed like many hotels in AMS don't include it). The breakfast room was very pleasant with music playing and a nice spread for such a small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodation, reasonable rates, warm hospitality”
Reviews.Author: ahotpoet
Reviews.Content: I had a single room which I originally booked for 2 nights but ended up staying 5. The room was comfortable but was definitely no frills. The location is in a very nice neighborhood near the concert hall and Van Gogh museum. This family run hotel is staffed with caring, kind people. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, lovely rooms, squeaky floors and cute cat.”
Reviews.Author: JodyPilkington
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was lovely. The family who run it are very helpful. The hotel is lovely and clean. Our room was big with lovely big windows. Beds are comfy. The floors are v squeaky so hard to creep round at night. Lovely shower. Beware the stairs as with any amsterdam accommodation. They have a cute cat called Mona and a nice garden off the breakfast room. Breakfast was lovely with lots of choice. The little tv was good for evening entertainment and hotel is close to nightlife and museums. It was quiet as it is away from main roads. there was some noise from passers by at night but the windows blocked most of the noise and it cant be helped as we went over the weekend. Best out of the 3 hotels we stayed at for our city break.

Reviews.Title: “comme Ã  la maison -feels like home”
Reviews.Author: mceiner
Reviews.Content: it is a hotel run by an Asian family which means that you are welcomed warmly and seen off like a member of an official delegation, which is quite nice actually and makes you feel like a VIP... The little room I had at the top of the mountain (3 flights of steep but small stairs) was charming . The hotel is quiet (but I was on the top floor) and the breakfast gave plenty of choice in cold food (yogourt, plenty of fruits, ham, cheese, several kind of bread and other crackers....hard-boiled eggs)..The shower was on the same level but the toilet downstairs but It was'nt a pb as you take into account this fact while going up /down..I felt very cosy and my stay was up all my expectations. Moreover, You can get free internet in the inner hotel nearby ...or buy some drinks or food from their vending machines. There is also a supermarket (albert heijn) just opposite the road to the concert hall

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: RB75
Reviews.Content: Good value for money in a good location. Safe and very close to Rijks/Van Gogh Museums. Also very close to tram line that will take you further into Amsterdam if you don't want to walk. Good breakfast and friendly staff. Room was very simple and small but clean. Concert one night of my stay outside Rijks Museum made sleep difficult but not the fault of the hotel. Very steep flight of stairs with no elevator - a little scary carrying luggage!! Room had small TV, shower, toilet and small sink. No hairdryer.

Reviews.Title: “INFESTED WITH BEDBUGS”
Reviews.Author: stillitching
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for an extended time. Changed rooms several times. Spots on all the bed linens. Bedbugs. We were bitten so badly that we had to go to the doctor. The doctor said they had never seen so many bites on one person. The owners, all family members didn't care at all. In fact the exterminator who showed up the morning we were covered in bites said to us that he had warned them many times to fix the bedbug problem but the family who runs the hotel did not want to spend the money. We woke up at 4AM covered in bedbugs. Dozens of them. It was like a horror movie. The fact that the hotel is in such a state of disrepair, curtains were filthy, most everything is broken and unsafe, should have told us something. Imagine putting long time staying guests knowingly in bedbug infested rooms? The exterminator told us that all the rooms were infested, not only the one we stayed in. My partner and I still are covered in bites weeks later. Dishonest family trying to save money foisting bug infested rooms on unsuspecting guests. There are so many negative things to see about this hotel. Stay at your own risk and don't be fooled by them.

Reviews.Title: “basic, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: ozibaba
Reviews.Content: If you like walking, centrum is 20 minutes of a joyful walk. Hotel location seems a bit far from the centrum on the map, but it is not that far if you can walk 20-30 minutes. There are many attractions on that walk, too. Tram to central station is only several minutes anyway. My room was on 3rd floor. Entire hotel is quite as a libary. Breakfast was very good. I would definetly stay here again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “small and basic, but clean and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Dalglish89
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel was quite pricey, it was in line with other Amsterdam hotel prices for the time of year (xmas), however, it is well run, clean and the family are all very friendly, even letting me use their office pc and printer when I needed to book museum tickets. Beds were very comfy and the room was quiet. Only a short walk from Van Gogh museum and Vondelpark, about 10 minutes to Rijksmuseum, and another 5 on to the Hard Rock. Jump on the 2 or 5 tram from the main junction just outside and you're right in the centre of town in 15 mins, great location, would come back.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING SERVICE FRIENDLY FAMILY ENVIRONMENT”
Reviews.Author: epic_traveller9
Reviews.Content: Me and my cousin stayed with hotel verdi for the duration of a week, I had previously travelled to amsterdam before so knew the cost of accomodation and expectation, Hotel Verdi is in a very good location being that it is right in the museum district walkable distance to leinsplain the main entertainmet area and the tram stop is around the corner. so easy excess to public transport. At the time of our stay we were in a very difficult situation and were so far away from home the other side of the world in fact, and the staff who are family members where understanding and very very very helpfull they truely make you stay feel very family friendly. I have stayed in other accomodation options including the hotel round the corner and one right next to hotel verdi and even a at a golden tullip hotel which is a four star but I must say ven tho the rooms are basic I would return to this place for my next visit to amsterdam in the future as sometimes it is not only the physical apperance of a place that maks for a good experience but also the freindly help and service.

Reviews.Title: “The Verdi is in need of a requiem”
Reviews.Author: midtermers
Reviews.Content: We too were victims of Room 12! Having read reviews from 2005 it looks like little has changed. The staircase is a health hazard. We only had light hand luggage but it would have been nearly impossible to get big suitcases up the 3 flights. Room 12 is narrow and small. It has twin beds. A dangerous looking light contraption is hanging off the wall. Decor is appalling. Breakfast was basic but adequate. Staff not unpleasant but hardly warm and welcoming. The real killer was that we had booked 2 rooms, were quoted the same price for each and found that Room 6, which our friends were given was quite a pleasant, reasonably well furnished room whilst Room 12 was really awful. We were only booked in for 1 night thank goodness. Had we been staying any longer we would certainly have booked out and looked for something else. There is far better value for money to be had elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: asp8188
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my stay here. The staff was on top of everything, very helpful and engaging. My room was clean and had a shower in it, with the toilet on the next floor up. Quiet at all times. The tram stop is immediately down the block. I'd read some prior reviews, most were relatively positive but had hints of people complaining about it being too basic, needing more amenities, etc... Yes, it is basic, but that's what you signed up for when you booked it. I knew in advance I had a shared toilet and, while I thought I knew what to expect for 50 Euros a night, I was wrong - I got better. This is a city where a pancake breakfast costs like 10 euros. Anyone who isn't satisfied with this hotel at this price is unreasonable and unrealistic and probably a bit of an elitist. There's a Marriot down the street, close to Leidsiplein - let me know how much that runs you. The staff were the best part. They are all family, and the father is the proprietor, with his daughters working as well. They were 100% helpful and accommodating to me at all times, from offering directions, internet, an electric converter, letting me have a late checkout for a nominal fee, and so on. If you want a clean, friendly hotel in a GREAT location, PLEASE bring these folks your business. It's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but all you need.”
Reviews.Author: kbing
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Verdi with my ten year old son. We picked it for its price and location (near the Van Gogh Museum) as this was the main reason for the trip. We had a double room, which was very clean and comfortable, although there was a strange smell throughout. The door to the en suite bathroom didn't close properly, but we had a TV and the beds were very comfortable. Some rooms have shared bathrooms, so if this isn't for you, ask for a room with a private one. The staff that we met were friendly if slightly aloof, but they gave us good directions. The breakfast was plentiful, cold meats and cereal etc, and the hotel is within walking distance of many attractions. Overall? Basic, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful but convenient location; basic room”
Reviews.Author: cathy1099
Reviews.Content: I had the "basic single" room on the top floor. It was a small room that was stuffed with a twin bed (in good shape--firm and comfortable), a narrow wardrobe, a sink, and a small desk mostly occupied by a TV and hot-water kettle. The bed was tucked under a dormer window, so the wall sloped in over my head--not good if you like to read sitting up in bed, but I didn't care. The room and neighborhood were quiet. The only noticeable annoyance was the complete lack of a place to hang my damp towel. The shower was in a room in the hall, and the toilet was down one flight of stairs. I never had to wait for access to either. Breakfast was bread, some cornflakes, what I think were hardboiled eggs, and the usual thin-sliced cheese and meats. I paid 55 euros for the room, which seemed to be a good deal for such a location. There was no public wifi.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the Verdi”
Reviews.Author: rig1963
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Friday at two and was greeted by a wonderful Japanese lady who dealt with us in a calm and friendly manner even to the point of dealing with our extra party member with the minimum of fuss even though she was fully booked she found him a spare bed in one of our rooms. the rooms were clean and spacious with a T.V plenty of storage for clothes. decorated in a contempory style with a strong Asian element, the beds were very comfortable after a long day and believe me if you decide to do the tour of Amsterdam you will be happy to sleep in these beds. breakfast was typical continental style, cold meats cheese, cereal, fruit etc, coffee tea fruit juice served from 0800 to 1000 the dining room was bright and sufficant for the number of guest but with 9 big burly blokes it soon became crowded. Mooky the cat was always present and made a nice touch with his white whiskers and black fur. The stairs were typical Dutch stairs steep and narrow but that only added to the charm, but needs to be mentioned if you have big feet like me or have a disablity. overall a great place to stay very calm and peaceful after a long day or night.

Reviews.Title: “What a friendly place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerGU14
Reviews.Content: We had no problems with the Hotel Verdi at all. The room although basic was clean and a nice place to crash out. The location is good in a quiet nice part of town, although maybe a bit far out if your not too keen on walking, however the trams round the corner are every few mins to take you all over the city (10 mins to RLD or Cent Station) and Liedesplien with loads of bars & restaurants is only a 5 min walk away. The owners of the hotel are really friendly and the old lady even did us some ironing for our night out - Now thats hospitallity! I'd recommend the Hotel Verdi to anyone and I will sure be back on my next trip to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but cheerful budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: SophieHazan
Reviews.Content: Three girls from the UK in Amsterdam for the ING Marathon. The Verdi serves a perfect base for a weekend break with friends or while on a budget. Go elsewhere if wanting luxury or a romantic get away as bedrooms are basic. Quiet and pretty location at the heart of the art quarter. Trams near-by with great access to centre, trains etc. Very friendly Japanese family still running the Verdi - traditional style building with steep steep steps. Decor is colourful and charming in a cluttered sort of way at ground level. Upstairs the decor is much more simple and hostel like. Rooms - our room for three was cluttered with furniture, but sheets were crisply clean and towels changed daily. Shower-room was small but very modern and sparklingly clean.

Reviews.Title: “A quirky, eccentric and pleasant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mikeyi
Reviews.Content: Right near the Vondelpark, in a lovely posh quiet area. Breakfast is good. Friendly, respectful staff. Clean. Mooky the little black cat is nice. Shower is good. Satellite TV in all rooms is a good touch. Piped music at beakfast times makes it seem like a scene from Twin Peaks!! I love it. There is however a pervading smell of onions. And to all the American folk complaining about the steep stairs: This is europe guys, buildings are old and they are built differently to houses in the states. Part of Amsterdams charm is the 'cosy' architecture, and steep, wobbly, narrow staircases are part of its eccentric charm. Are the stairs to steep or are you too fat and unfit? Just kidding guys. See you soon Hotel Verdi.

Reviews.Title: “What Breakfast?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we booked a trip to amsterdam and stayed at the hotel verdi after reading the reviews previously posted on this site firstly the stairs were dangerous not just steep secondly the breakfast worth a second visit i don't think so just bread cheese and coffee service well this was the only plus the staff were very plesant but could give no advice on the city as they had only been in amsterdam a short time worth the journey NO

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with steep stairs -- worth the climb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Japanese-family owned hotel is a great place to stay in while vacationing in Amsterdam. We stayed in room 12 (all the way at the top) and we loved it! We had our own private bathroom, toilet and shower, and it was decently priced. Stayed December 26, 2004 to December 29, 2004 and if we ever return to Amsterdam, we plan to stay at Hotel Verdi. The downside are the steep stairs and that keeps me from rating it 5. The included buffet breakfast is filling and there's a nice variety. The staff is very welcoming and after a cold winter day, we return to the hotel in the evening and they offer to make us some tea. Overall, money will spent! Location is awesome -- near the Van Gogh museum and it is on a quiet, well lit street! Also family friendly, if it matters to some.
